[Faculty of Natural Health Science via distance learning](/programs/faculty-of-natural-health-science.html) Aromatherapy via distance learning This program deals with the art of using volatile plant oils, externally and internally, for preventive health care, healing, beauty, and relaxation. Essential oils are highly concentrated plant extracts that can be distilled from the roots, flowers, leaves, and stalks of plants and/or trees. They release specific scents that act on the hypothalamus of the human brain to deeply affect its physical and/or mental condition. [More info...](/degrees/online-continuing-education-courses.html) Human Anatomy & Physiology This course describes the organization and function of the human body. It explores the microscopic structure of its constituent, their interrelationships, and their integration within the body as a whole. Academic Supervisor: Marcos Mazzuka Petitta Touch & Palpation This course discusses the constituents of the musculo-skeletal system (muscles and bones) while integrating the principles of anatomy with the theoretical techniques of palpation, as particularly applied to the muscular system. It explains the process of palpation of bony landmarks and superficial muscles. Academic Supervisor: Stefan Batran Aga Essential Oils This course covers the history and uses of volatile plant oils, externally and internally, for preventive health care, healing, beauty, and relaxation. Essential oils; extracted from the roots, flowers, leaves, and stalks of plants as well as from certain trees, release their specific aromatic scents and act on the hypothalamus of human brain to affect our physical and mental condition. Academic Supervisor: Ruben Von Stopeck Aromatherapy Massage This course combines the properties of essential oils with massage therapy to restore and enhance health, beauty, and overall well-being. It integrates two of the oldest forms of therapy, aroma and massage, to calm, relieve, nurture, and balance the patient´s body, mind, and soul. Academic Supervisor: Stefan Batran Aga Natural Perfumes This course explains the uses of essential oils in cosmetology to create natural perfumes for skin care and the techniques of mixing aromatic oils with natural cosmetic products without harsh chemical ingredients for the use in natural beauty treatments. Academic Supervisor: Ruben Von Stopeck Aromatherapy This course explains the preparation and therapeutic uses of essential oils, how they influence the patient's nervous and lymphatic system, and how they help to restore a variety of health conditions using the appropriate aromatherapy support. It shows the characteristics of the different administration options of essential oils: orally, rectally, vaginally, by inhalation, and/or massage. Academic Supervisor: Ruben Von Stopeck Hydrotherapy This course explains the application of water treatments (hot and cold) to reinforce its therapeutic and physiological effects in the treatments of illness and injury. It describes several spa and hydrotherapy treatments including ice therapy, hydrotherapy tub/whirlpool, alternate hot and cold therapies, vichy shower, mud treatments, and fomentation. It also considers water treatments combined with aromatherapy through the use of different inhaled essences. If you have any further questions, please let us know. :) METHOD OF INSTRUCTION: Distance Learning Higher Education This distance learning education program is completed by a traditional correspondence instruction method. Once you sign up for the course, Bircham International University will send you (to your mailing address) the suggested textbooks. After reading the book, you will be asked to write a 20 to 35 pages report that reflect your understanding of the book. This report is equivalent to the exam and can be submitted by email or mail. Bircham International University will evaluate your written work. If passed, BIU will issue the corresponding diploma. For more instructions about BIU pedagogy, tutoring, and evaluation, please read our distance learning education study guide. [More info...](/study-guide.html) Students enrolling into this distance education program should be aware that: 1. Location: Bircham International University needs a functional geographical location to ship the book and materials for successful completion of this program of study. 2. Communication: Email, courier, phone are key communication instruments with Bircham University that play an important role in the progress and support of this program of study. 3. Capacity: Any impediment, physical or psychological, to read a book and write a report must be communicated to Bircham International University prior to enrollment into this distance learning program. 4. Technology: No specific technology is required to complete this distance education program. 5. Language: Book reading and report writing in other language than English must be requested (and approved by BIU) prior to enrollment in any distance learning program. 6. Discrimination: There is no discrimination with respect to race, color, gender, beliefs or religion. 7. Age: Check the admission requirements for each distance education degree program. [More info...](/admission.html) Duration - Aromatherapy Online via distance learning For a program of 21 credits, the estimated time for completion is 21 weeks. For 45 credits, the estimated time for completion will be 45 weeks, and so on. Calculations are approximate. The length of each distance learning degree program is calculated based on an average of 15 hours of learning per week. It also depends on the number of validated credits from previous knowledge and the level of commitment to the studies.
